definition: to be a favorite/favor
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
to love/to pamper/to spoil/to favor

sentences.english: He referred to rumors in the graces of the hand-picked running mate Cui Jianbang any master of ceremonies?
sentences.chinese: 提到他欽點傳聞中得寵的崔建邦拍檔任司儀？

sentences.english: Fwaterdrop-hwaterdroped mans tend to receive special treatment by theirs bosses.
sentences.chinese: 得寵的人，較會受到她們上司的特別待遇。

sentences.english: Managers lost enthusiasm for integrated oils and other energy stocks.
sentences.chinese: 石油與其他能源類股也因此不再得寵。

sentences.english: Not being a fair-haired boy, Mr. Wong never gets pay-raises and promotions.
sentences.chinese: 王先生不得寵，從未得到加薪和升級。

sentences.english: And King hasn´t always been a favourite among literary critics either.
sentences.chinese: 此外，金在文學評論界也同樣很不得寵。

sentences.english: Vanity keeps people in favor of themselves who are out of favor with all others.
sentences.chinese: 虛榮使人得寵於己，而失寵於人。

sentences.english: Fair-haired boys tend to receive special treatment by their bosses.
sentences.chinese: 得寵的人，較會受到他們上司的特別待遇。

definition: to receive favor (from superior)/favored/pampered
to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
to settle a marriage/betrothal
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
chastity/virginity (of women)/moral integrity (of men)/loyalty/constancy
in a pique/sulky/cross
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
postal kiosk/(old) rest shelter for couriers
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
advice/to advise
see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
root of Chinese pulsatilla/Chinese bulbul
fellow villager
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
